abstract: A top White House adviser questioned the need on Sunday for a blanket halt to home foreclosures, even as pressure grows on the Obama administration to do something about growing evidence that banks have used inaccurate documents to evict homeowners.
snippet: A top White House adviser questioned the need on Sunday for a blanket halt to home foreclosures, even as pressure grows on the Obama administration to do something about growing evidence that banks have used inaccurate documents to evict homeowner...
lead_paragraph: A top White House adviser questioned the need on Sunday for a blanket halt to home foreclosures, even as pressure grows on the Obama administration to do something about growing evidence that banks have used inaccurate documents to evict homeowners, The Associated Press reported.

headline.main: White House Aide Doubts Need to Halt Foreclosures

abstract: Figuring out the role of Mortgage Electronic Registration System, or MERS, in the mortgage market will be important in the investigations into the foreclosure process, says Peter J. Henning in the White Collar Watch column.
snippet: Figuring out the role of Mortgage Electronic Registration System, or MERS, in the mortgage market will be important in the investigations into the foreclosure process, says Peter J. Henning in the White Collar Watch column.
lead_paragraph: Peter J. Henning follows issues involving securities law and white-collar crime for DealBook’s White Collar Watch.

headline.main: The Next Step in the Foreclosure Investigations

abstract: DealBook was on hand for the scene of US Banker’s eighth annual Most Powerful Women in Banking Awards — pictures included.
snippet: DealBook was on hand for the scene of US Banker’s eighth annual Most Powerful Women in Banking Awards — pictures included.
lead_paragraph: For at least one night this week, more than a few Wall Street executives put on a smile — and a ballgown.

headline.main: Raising a Glass to Wall Street’s Top Women

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
